text:
e="preserve">Anne Rivers Siddons (January 9, 1936 – September 11, 2019) was an American novelist. She was known for her stories set in the Southern United States. She was born in Fairburn, Georgia. Her best known books include: "Peachtree Road", "The House Next Door" and "Sweetwater Creek".
Siddons died on September 11, 2019 in Charleston, South Carolina of lung cancer at the age of 83.
